woot woot!

I havent booked yet was waiting to find others, im down to spend up to $500 or $600 per night max id say for my third, cuz i wouldve have to pay more than that alone. But if people dont want to spend up to that thats fine iâ€™ll look lower price, as long as reviews are really positive.
not made my mind on the budget yet - whats the room you booked coming at?
https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowTopic-g294262-i1747-k4299957-Travel_to_Suntec_City-Singapore.html

I have not booked yet but i guess it will be easier you continue your split for 22nd too - more convenient. Meantime if we find an option for a 3 bed, that will be awesome!

I hope you folks looking somehting near the conference venue itself? Let share if i find smth good

If not im fine with sharing with you on the 21st Coal and iâ€™ll sort something out for the 22nd
If not maybe we can all find something with 3 beds
@undefined did u already book one?
Room share

I'll be in Singapore from 6 pm on 20th September and go to the ETHGlobal Hackathon. Just need a place to refresh and store my luggage for three nights.
Just create a thread for anyone who's interested in sharing the room to coordinate a date and time.
Pre-Conference Room Share
I was trying to let you have it the 22nd, and help him split it on the 21st
I'm looking to split for 22nd
My flight gets in around 9pm 9/21, maybe I could split that room with you that night. I'd figure something else out 9/22.
Sounds nice to me!

I would likely get a business visa for Singapore - am working with a firm there and they have agreed to sponsor one for me. 

Will check with them on the Malaysia visa situation. On paper, we dont need any if we travel to SGP once a month (which we will for sure) - but always better to be fully sorted with such stuff.

Also open to share the room on 22nd.

Iâ€™m looking to split a hotel with someone for the 21st and 22nd, if you or anyone else is interested. Would like to book within next day or two.

We're planning for a few buses from Singapore to Forest City on Sept 23. Exact times will be shared once the details are finalized. 

But if you can't catch the one of the buses, there are other options:

1) Take the subway to Tuas MRT, and then take a 4.5 SGD bus that runs once per hour
2) Call your own taxi from a Singaporean cab company

Would reentering Malayasia after 30 day visits be a problem, read mixed things on Reddit. For Indians itâ€™s visa free till December end, however I was thinking to apply for a one year multiple entry visa so the Malaysians donâ€™t think weâ€™re trying to misuse the visa waiver. What do you think

I'm not sure if there are any clinics or supermarkets in Forest City. From my research, there's a shopping mall called Aeon Mall about 30-40 minutes away by car. So here you go: https://aeonmallmy.com/mall/aeon-mall-bukit-indah/stores

Hey NS team, it might help to do a poll to see whoâ€™s going to the SG conference and whoâ€™s heading straight to Forest City from Malaysia. Then you can arrange transportation for the conference group.
North Carolina or Florida depending on a few things ðŸ™‚
Taxi or Grab (Asia's Uber/lyft) is easy in Singapore. The Train (MRT) is also very efficient and cheap

Would a 9AM flight arrival in Singapore on the 23rd be too late for group transport to Forest City? @undefined @undefined (Sorry for blowing up the chats, I imagine others may share my questions ðŸ˜… )
im pretty flexible when it comes to what airport to depart from since Boston (Logan Airport) is kinda limited on flight options
sweet forsure! where in the east coast are you/plan to fly out of?
I'm flying from the east coast as well let's connect!
Iâ€™m coming on the 15th for side events and token 2049
Guys do check with the ns school people before mentioning anything in an application, what we can declare about ns school or not.

So for the Network School are we staying in the Forest City Marina Hotel or is it some other accommodation there?

https://www.booking.com/hotel/my/forest-city-phoenix.html

For now I will apply for the standard SG visa available and request multi-entry, as well as write to the Malaysian High Commission for considering extension. An official admit confirming my acceptance and duration of the program would really help

Anybody looking at locations, I'm planning on using a taxi / lyft to get to the conference venue. The hotels up by the airport are around $120 US per night, which is about half of what I'm seeing closer to Sunatec
I was so excited about joining the Network School, I already booked everything a few days ago... ðŸ˜Š  but happy to connect at the conference in Singapore! relying on serendipity for that one.
Also open to rebooking and sharing a hotel room with someone ðŸ™‚
Dream Lounge Capsule Pod: 259A Jln Besar, Singapore 208934
Which hostel do you recommend? Thanks ðŸ™‚ Iâ€™m booking my stay in Singapore from the 20th now and if anyone wants to share a hotel room feel free to let me know

We shared visa information via email earlier, but since there's a lot of related discussion re-sharing visa options for Network Schoolers based on the Passport Index data (passportindex.org/country/malaysia): 

1) If youâ€™re green with a 90 day stay youâ€™re fine for the duration of the Network School. Example: Canadians can just enter Malaysia for 90 days.

2) If youâ€™re green or blue with a 30 day stay, youâ€™ll need to do one of the following:

2a) Get a Malaysia Single Entry visa for 30 days per entry and 90 days total 

2b) Get a Malaysia digital nomad visa: mdec.my/derantau/foreign 

2c) Travel to Singapore to re-enter Malaysia every 30 days, which is feasible if you can enter Singapore

2d) Travel from Malaysia to another neighboring country (like Indonesia) every 30 days, which is more time consuming
Hostel prices are reasonable, around 70 usd per night (at the moment at least). If you don't mind sleeping in a room with other people that's a viable option.
@undefined what visa category are you applying for? Can you please share links and details about the visa you're considering?
Since hotel prices will be crazy, might it be possible to go to Forest City already on 22nd?
Application takes a day, but it might take 10 days to get the visa

@undefined @undefined could we get an admit letter with our details and program info, duration for the same? Would help applying for SG multiple entry visa + we may write to Malaysian High Commission for the same too. <:pepe_pray:969829993968443402>
can you ask how much time will the application take

FYI, people planning to stay on 22nd night for the conference, but we all know the prices are insane because of F1. Iâ€™ll be trying couchsurfing. I have done it before, and I have had one of the best  experiences!
What time do you get in for the conference?
Thanks for making this! I'm going through San Francisco on the 18th, and then in Japan for 2.5 days, flying from Tokyo and landing just after midnight on the 22nd.

Malaysia we just need a digital card which will not be an issue
At the end of 30 days we can go to Singapore and come back

Hey hey @undefined, here from New Delhi. Same question pretty much. Will be applying for 1 month SG visa this week, it appears we have Visa free entry into Malaysia for 30 days (with a DAC, also requires return ticket + hotel confirmation).

Per my understanding, we may need to fly back every 30 days, or reapply SG visa each month to go across the border and return to Malaysia to reset the 30 day clock?

Wonder if we can get an official NS admit letter with our details and program duration, and can get an extended duration approved from the Malaysia High Commission.
India NS planning

Welcome to the Network School logistics channel. Put everything related to travel and visa stuff here. You can DM @undefined and @undefined for private help as well.
